paper.title: Randomness-Optimal Characterization of Two NP Proof Systems
paper.venue: Randomization and Approximation Techniques in Computer Science
paper.abstract: We investigate quantitative aspects of randomness in two types of proof systems for NP: two-round public-coin witness-indistinguishable proof systems and non-interactive zero-knowledge proof systems. Our main results are the following: :[30],"if NP has a 2-round public-coin witness-indistinguishable proof system then it has one using Θx(n ∈ + log(1/s)) random :[30],"if NP has a non-interactive zero-knowledge proof system then it has one using :[50],"Θ(n ∈ +log(1/s)) random :[68],"s is the soundness error, n the length of the input, and ∈ can be any constant u003c 0. These results only assume that NP ≠ average-BPP. As a consequence, assuming the existence of one-way functions, both classes of proof systems are characterized by the same randomness complexity as BPP algorithms.
